channel.title: Personal on The mind of Esteban
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on The mind of Esteban

item.title: Career change
item.description: Sudden realisation Early last year (2019) I came to the realisation that I needed a changeâ€¦ I’ve been coding for a long time, doing iOS for the biggest part of my career, and at some point (even though I don’t consider myself an â€œexpertâ€) it started to becomed a bit dull. This was not for a lack of challenges, as there was always something new, e.g.:SwiftUI, Combine, Marzipan, iPadOS, you name it; but at one point or the other it lost some of the spark âœ¨

item.title: ğŸ“¦ Wrapping up 2016
item.description:
I’ve been away for quite some time now and a lot of things have changed since I last had the time to blog.

I’ll try to detail everything that has happened in my life in the past few months and also prepare for my yearly wrap-up post.

item.title: Review: 2015
item.description:
Last year I made a list of resolutions and also blogged about it; overall it was a great year; completed almost all my resolutions and had the chance to grow A LOT professionally (or so I think).

A small round down of my previous year:

  • Got turned down by Slack: Basically applied to Slack and everything went OK but I suck at interviews; I think I don’t know how to sell myself properly and was turned down.
    No hard feelings though, they felt I wasn’t a good fit for the team and they got to do what’s best for the team.

item.title: How to (and not) ask questionsâ€¦
item.description:
Is it safe to say that I’ve been Â«scoldedÂ» twice this week due to my technical questions.

Nowâ€¦ I was not scolded as the word implies but the context was that; and I did deserve it if I’m honest.

item.title: 21DaysChallenge
item.description:
Is a Â«well knownÂ» fact that I’m trying to get to 12% body fat; last year I was really close at 14% but then I ricocheted back to 17% and my mental state took a toll and was not able to get back on track. I’ve been going up & down on my body fat since then.

Last December I hit horrible numbers because I pretty much gave up on exercising ğŸ’ª and dieting ğŸŒ¿ Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯

item.title: New Website
item.description:
Â«ClearlyÂ» the site has changed (as long as you have been following me; if not then perhaps this is Â«shocking newsÂ» for you).

I started the blog with Jekyll and quickly Â«movedÂ» to Octopress for its Â«simplicityÂ» to make new posts, pages and change themes; or so I thought.

After some time having to deal with it and then having to create a blog for Log(n)’s employees (being that I’m one of them at the moment) gave me some insights as to how convoluted the process is.

item.title: New Year Resolutions
item.description: I’ve got the opportunity to read Ash Furrow’s post about his 5 years doing iOS development and read (as much as I could from my phone) Orta’s blog about his 28 and came to think about MY year and decided I was going to write something. Doing this as quickly as possible while my 7 months old is sleeping and my girlfriend is finishing all preparations before we leave home to meet the families.
